title: Uncorrect matching between frames and analyze plotting
body:
**Your Operating system and DeepLabCut version**
Example: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS, with an Anaconda Env, & DeepLabCut 2.0.6.2

**Describe the bug**
bad frame extraction with extract_outlier_frames function (opencv as reader can't read correctly our video) : Is the problem due to video compression format ?
![Capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45424082/59833047-8aab0100-9345-11e9-959c-b2c46d07e30e.png)
![Capture5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45424082/59833067-94346900-9345-11e9-9ddb-9dd66f60bd0c.png)



**To Reproduce**
After analyze_videos 
- We check the labels with create_labeled_video : The plotting is almost ok, and we would like to correct some positions. 
- We run extract_outlier_frames : the fonction give us a huge quantity of outlier frames (ie : 180/200 !) 
- We open them with refine_labels we can observe that almost all positions are shifted (seem correct relative to each other but don't match the positions on the frame).
The explanation is that the video is not correctly read by opencv, and some frames are duplicated (we can see it when running "refine" with manual option to display all the frames) . So the analysis function open and analyze all the frames correctly but the extract_outlier can't and when the refine function read a frame the overlayed plot come from another frame. 

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

sincerely

gilles
